description:
Be the first to bring your penguins to safety over the open sea before the ice bridges melt! The five bridges are made of real ice, so you have to put the mould for the bridge´s in the freezer before you play. There are two sets of moulds so you always have bridge´s to play with. You have to cross the bridge´s before they melt and collapses. If one bridge melts, take another way with a bridge still intact.
Sabotage by destroying strategic ice bridges by spraying water or pouring salt, or give your competitors a cold shower so they fall into the sea and start their hike again.

Two sets of bridges, so one can always be in the freezer!

A fun & different game that engages!

How the game is played:

The player that first moves their penguins across the ice to the goal has won. The other the team's start is your goal. But hurry up before the ice bridges are melting, and watch out for falling in the water!
Every time it's your turn, you should:

     Roll the dice, and possibly move a penguin.
     Pick up an event card.


Use one or two cards (your choice).

Spin the spinner to see what to feed the kitty. But be careful...give him too many veggies and he will flip his plate! Be the first player to feed the kitty all of your vegetables without the kitty flipping your veggies to win!

Bring home the excitement of a Las Vegas casino in a board game. Players work their way around the board as a group and play all the great casino games including Poker, Blackjack, Roulette and Craps.  The winner is the player who has the most money when the first person crosses the finish line.

A cooperative ecology-themed board game for having fun with friends and relatives and learning to respect the environment!

The aim of the game is to clean up the earth and help to safeguard its natural beauty: by extinguishing fires, reducing smog and pollution in our cities and clearing waste from the oceans.

The game relies on cooperative rules to remind the family about the importance to take care of our planet all together.

The aim of games of the Play for Future range is to help everyone understand the importance of sustainability and respect for the environment through play.

Conceived, designed and developed in Italy.

Four kingdoms exist, in the four cardinal directions of the map. The snow leopards in the mountains to the north, the jaguars to the east in the plains, the tigers to the south near the jungle, and the lions to the west in the grasslands. These four kingdoms have been at war for as long as can be remembered - and they’ve built nuance to their battle plans over centuries. Can you lead your Kingdom to victory?

Competing Cat Castles is a game of deduction, risk, and luck for 2-4 players. Your goal is to win more competitions than your opponents. Each round you will select one of the nine cards representing the key players in each kingdom. Every cat plays a part, from the Monarch down to the youngest baby. Several of these key players have abilities that can hinder your opponent, or boost your next turn. Players play their chosen cat face down and reveal them simultaneously. The cat with the highest power wins, after any abilities have been applied.

Keeping track of who your opponents have played and who you have to counter them will lead to victory, but never discount luck.

—description from the designer

White sandy beaches, the gentle sound of waves, and a well-functioning drug cartel: this is what the "Isla de Cubaidos" is known for — that, and its international superstar Dayana.

But for you, the Caribbean paradise could soon become hell because the secret drug network that you have built up on the island is threatened by a public scandal: Dayana has disappeared on the island without a trace. Can you find out what happened to her before the police search party arrives and inspects your island?

Masters of Crime: Rapture is a co-operative deductive murder mystery game in which players must solve puzzles, follow clues and make decisions to solve a case. They do this using the included deck of cards, twelve hidden realistic clue documents, and the Internet. Through a choose-your-own-adventure mechanism, players make decisions that influence the course of the game and lead to solving the case in the end. One by one, they enter different realistically designed locations and encounter the various suspects. Then they choose from three different ways to deal with the situation and receive points based on their decisions. Complex puzzles and escape room elements must be solved in order to progress further in the case.

The game is closely intertwined with the real world, and players have to keep using traditional apps like Google Maps or Wikipedia to gather information. Email, detailed web pages, and cell phone calls are also part of the immersive gaming experience.

SUM8 is a two player tile based, puzzle-like strategy game with a rearrangeable board, unique tile design and extreme re-playability.

The gameplay is simple: you play against your opponent, each player starting with 8 tiles. In alternating moves you create circles and then eventually '8's in a puzzle like sequence to score points to victory, but don't give your opponent the opportunity to score big!

On their turn, players place a tile onto the board, or move an already placed tile on the board to a new spot. This will give the player points based on what / where they place the tile.

The game ends when all tiles are played, or no one is able to place or move a tile. The player with the highest score wins!

During the game, players can discuss with each other what cards they have (but do not show the cards). The object of the game is to lay down cards that help the next player to lay down their hand so that the game is not interrupted. If you can;t, then you must turn over 1 of the wolf cards.

If the players folded six cards from each of the seven families, they won. Conversely, if all six wolf cards are turned over, the wolves win and the players lose the game!

It's no cinch getting to the delicious cherries in the garden of Mr. Scrooge, the next door neighbour, because 2 dogs are keeping a watchful guard over the cherry tree. Only a child who really knows how to use a fishing line can outwit the guard dogs and hang the pair of cherries he's caught over his ears.

The game is constructed in a box with wooden cherries in pairs attached to strings inside.  The is also one pair of dogs attached to strings in the box.

Children take turn using the wooden fishing pole to hook the cherries - avoiding the dogs. The game ends when the cherries run out.  The child who hooks the most cherries wins.  If a child hooks the dogs, the game stops and they lose.

Do you want to explore cities, temples, jungles and islands? Hunt treasures and a lot of gold? Fight pirates and players? Go for an epic conquest of the Caribbean? Then Ship Adventure is made for you! The board of Ship Adventure is made of 36 tiles that allowed an unimaginable number of board combinations to make each playing experience unique.

Ship Adventure is a 2 games in 1 with a treasure hunt mode and a conquest mode.

In Ship Adventure - Treasure Map, players move their ship and crew on the board, choosing the quickest itinerary to reach cities, temples, treasure tokens and pieces of treasure map. Along the journey, they are going to purchase equipment to boost their ship so they perform better score when launch their dice during fights. The game end when a player has gathered the 4 different pieces of treasure map and has reached the coordinates indicated on the puzzle formed by the 4 pieces on the board.

In Ship Adventure - Caribbean Conquest at each turn player move their fleet and armies on the board in order to take the control over strategic points. Each strategic points gives gold coins at the end of the turn which are used to purchase equipment and new units. The game ends when a player controls the majority of the strategic areas or when a player has been eliminated.

Alarm in Wimmelstadt! A gang of thieves is roaming the streets and squares, stealing everything they can get their hands on.
This is a case for the clever reading police! They quickly have a look at the city and follow the clues read to them by the head of police. He tells them where they can find an important witness, a partner in crime, or a crime scene. With these clues they can find the perpetrators and the loot.

Listen carefully and look closely, and you can find the clues you're looking for, with a bit of luck, you can catch all the bags from the robbery boss and stop to the thieves. But beware: if the boss of the thieves has most of the loot in his hiding place, the thieves have won.

This game playfully promotes reading and listening skills
of children in preschool and first reading age. Since the game also requires close observation, it also improves the ability to concentrate.

In this card game, every player gets five cards. During his turn, each player put one card face up in front of him. For every smiling face, he gets a chip and puts it on his card. For every sad face, he can take a chip from another player. 
The player with most chips wins.

—user summary

Become a leader of the women’s suffrage movement demanding votes for women! Be inspired by history or choose a different path as you conduct actions,  grow the movement of supporters and ultimately win the vote!

Suffrage is a card based board game about the iconic and pivotal struggle for women’s suffrage in early 20th century Britain and Ireland. Each player takes the role of one of six historical women, all interesting and important personalities in the movement. The goal of the game is to acquire a large enough movement and persuade enough male MP’s over at Parliament to support the cause of votes for women. The game consists of 110 cards and 60 custom suffrage supporter miniatures.

On each turn, players choose 1 of the available action cards. Depending on what kind of action is chosen, some supporters will join the movement, while others will leave. Suffragettes for example will gladly join the cause, planting bombs and conducting sabotage, while Suffragists instead support peaceful actions, slow and steady. Similairly, the upper class women and the working class women support - and reject - different actions. It is up to the player to choose which path is most efficient, based on the available action cards.

Once a large enough movement is gathered, the player goes to the Parliament, where - based on the size of the movement - a certain number of MP's (Members of Parliament) will either vote YES or NO to the demand of women's right to vote. A player wins the game by getting at least 10 YES votes.

How would you react if you woke up with a Sheetz tattoo? What if you made an M*T*O Burger so big you couldn’t fit it in your mouth? Find out in this hilarious adult (13+) party game! Compete with your friends to see who will be crowned Freak of the Memez by matching Pic Cardz with Caption Cardz, and creating your own Sheetzy meme combos.

Uses What Do You Meme? game mechanics. Each round, one player takes the role of judge and plays a photo card, after which everyone else plays a caption card to complete the meme. The judge decides the funniest pairing, and whoever played the winning caption card wins the round.

Can You Master The Dribble? Patience and dexterity are needed to conquer this unique challenge. The further you get the ball from one end of the twisting pegs to the other without the ball falling through, the higher your score. Use the larger glass ball or the smaller, more difficult metal ball.

This dexterity game consists of a long wooden board with 4 squares marked out with point values.

Attached to the board are two parallel wooden rods, slightly above the scoring squares. The rods have smaller offset spokes attached in a spiral that move the ball along as the rods turn.

Players must attempt to join the spokes on both rods making the ball roll "uphill" before it drops into a scoring square. The player with the most points wins.

Men (Egyptian: Mn) is a 5,000 year old game from ancient Egypt. It is roughly contemporaneous with Mehen and Senet. One of the most mysterious of ancient games, only two partial boards have been discovered by archaeologists, along with a detailed tomb painting depicting the board layout and playing pieces, and one sculpture depicting players playing it aboard a ship. Game scholar and designer Zach Horton recreated a speculative version of the game and it was released in two versions by Pandora Games: as a deluxe boxed Kickstarter set with Mehen and later as a standalone game. This modern reconstruction closely follows the ancient evidence and produces a unique game with a trading theme wherein players send ships out on trading missions and wager on when they will return, while manipulating them en route in an attempt to fulfill their own predictions and foils their opponents'.

The game utilizes a unique three-dimensional board, enabling playing pieces to be placed both flat on spaces and upright in grooves. This aspect has been re-created in the modern version utilizing a handmade wooden board.

On their turn, each player chooses on their turn from a number of different options, from gaining sticks to throw to obtaining movement banks that can be accumulated for later sprints, to sending a new ship off on its journey. No player “owns” any of the ships. Any player may move any combination of ships however they wish. Victory points are obtained by performing certain actions (setting sail, picking up goods, bringing goods home), as well as by correctly predicting how long a given ship will be at sea. Every time a ship sets sail, all players mark their prediction on a simple, but hidden, ledger. When a ship returns, predictions are checked against the actual results. Meanwhile, all players manipulate conditions on the board to try to make their own predictions come true!

Any number of ships can be sailed in a game, but only 5 can be on the board at any given time. Only 5 cargoes can be picked up and returned to port during the game.  Once all have been picked up, 
ships can continue to sail, but do not pick up any cargo on the Foreign Port space (though they must  still pause there).
Once all 5 cargoes have been returned to Port, the game ends.  After scoring that ship, the player with the most Victory Points wins.

Each player must gather enough resources (Influence (cubes), Adepts (meeples), Powers (tokens)) to light the flames of the PANTACLE one by one. These resources can only be obtained by requesting favors from the Keepers of the PANTACLE. There are 7 types of favors that provide either resources or powers whose effects will make your progress easier. Beware though! If another player has the right set of cards in hand, they can counter your request and bribe the favor away from you.

To light a flame on the PANTACLE, players regularly need to sacrifice accumulated resources. The further players progress, the harder the PANTACLE resists and the more complex the game becomes. Indeed, a player who lights a flame receives a reward (resource, power) but also a curse, despite the sacrifice of resources. The Keepers can suspend a Curse for a time, but will the other players let them?

—description from the publisher

The witty board game "Visit Lithuania while riding the horse" is a great party entertainment and an almanac of the strangest place names. The game will make you smile and cause surprise. Here it will become clear that Vilnius is in Kupiškis district, KlaipÄ—da is a suburb of PanevÄ—Å¾ys, and Lithuania has both Foreign and its own Colony. These are funny, witty and unexpected place names of Lithuania country, which can be found on closer examination of the map.

Saddle your horse and surround your estates as the Grand Duke of Lithuania - be it MeškuiÄiai, ZuikinÄ— or Vištytis. And your horse will definitely enjoy visiting the Sheepskin, Cabbage or Horse Pastures.

On their turn, players move around the board with horse similar to a knight in chess. Player have cards in hand with places they must visit. The game ends when first player has visited all places in his  hand and returns to start/finish position. Whoever finishes first is the winner.

The board game has 3 versions of the rules: the main "Play against opponents", a team game and the "Play against the system" game.

Šmaikštus stalo Å¾aidimas „Apjok LietuvÄ…“ – puiki vakarÄ—lio pramoga ir paÄiÅ³ keisÄiausiÅ³ vietovardÅ¾iÅ³ almanachas. Å½aidimas privers nusišypsoti ir sukels nuostabÄ…. ÄŒia paaiškÄ—s, kad Vilnius yra Kupiškio rajone, KlaipÄ—da – PanevÄ—Å¾io priemiestis, o Lietuva turi ir UÅ¾sienÄ¯, ir savo KolonijÄ…. Tai – juokingi, šmaikštÅ«s ir netikÄ—ti mÅ«sÅ³ šalies vietovardÅ¾iai, kuriuos galima rasti atidÅ¾iau tyrinÄ—jant Lietuvos Å¾emÄ—lapÄ¯.

Balnokite Å¾irgelÄ¯ ir kaip Lietuvos didysis kunigaikštis apjokite savo valdas – ar tai bÅ«tÅ³ MeškuiÄiai, ar ZuikinÄ—, ar Vištytis. O jÅ«sÅ³ Å¾irgui tikrai patiks apsilankyti AviÅ¾onyse, KopÅ«stuose ar Å½irgÅ³ Ganyklose. Kas pirmas apjos, tas ir laimÄ—s.

The Lost Spells is a card game based on the stunning book by best-selling author Robert MacFarlane, and Illustrator of over 40 beloved classics, Jackie Morris.

As with its predecessor, The Lost Words Card Game, the game is won by pairing the Spell (poem) cards in your hands with the beautifully illustrated Nature cards before your opponent. However, the Spells in this game are only revealed when you collect the correct amount of key cards! Is your memory good enough to remember the whereabouts of your card and will it be stolen by your opponents Foxy card? The first player to collect 6 pairs of cards, wins!

Carefully open the door, and poke his belly to make sure he’s asleep. Did Papa stay snoozing? Whew – that was a close one! You can now take one of his goodies. But if you press your luck…Papa is going to wake up and jump out of the cave, and you’ll have to give away your goodies! If you can catch him with your ‘bear’ hands, your goodies are safe. The player with the most goodies wins the game!

Players roll a die and collect a goodie or poke the bear's belly, depending on the die roll. Play continues until the Bear's belly is poked and the release mechanism shoots the bear in the air.  The player who catches the bear keeps all their goodies; the other players lose 1 goodie.

The game ends either when the bear jumps or the goodie basket is empty.  The player with the most goodies wins.

Duel Trading Card Game is a realtime online card game where players assume the role of a powerful mage, casting spells and abilities trying to reduce their opponents HP to 0 to win the duel. There are no creatures or items allowed in the Tournament of Gods, so player’s decks that they build consist entirely of spells and abilities. Duel is realtime, meaning there are no turns and both players receive 1 Mana every 5 seconds to use to draw cards and cast spells and abilities.

Cast a spell by spending the amount of Mana listed as a gold number in the top right of the card and set the projectile sideways on one of the Spell Timers in the center of the field. Set it facing your opponents, as if it was in the air on its way to hit them. Your opponent then has 10 seconds to hit that incoming attack with one of their own, (and if the one that they use is double the ATK or more of the one it collided with it not only kills the weaker one but also continues on towards the enemy’s HP.) or use a quick-play ability such as Blink or Reflect.

Players make decks of 50 cards that have no other restrictions whatsoever, just a 50 card max, but they do also have something called a Type Mastery, which is a single type (card color) that they can cast for 1 less Mana and take one less Damage from. There’s no limit to how many spells can be used against a single incoming attack, and there’s no limit on how many can be played per turn, or how many cards players can draw per turn either, the only limit is how much Mana you have.

This entry is for the Kickstarter edition with additional content in the box. Limited content consists of 54 cards.

The 54 Kickstarter Limited cards are: 32 regular enemy cards, 9 regular encounter card, 3 companion ally cards, and 10 reward cards.

The Limited cards have a text at the bottom saying: LIMITED. They are numbered 331 - 384.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists is is a fully cooperative card-based adventure game set in a world of mystery, eldritch powers and perilous adventures. Heart of the Mists continues the story of Mistfall in a standalone expansion featuring new Heroes, Enemies, Encounters and Quests, and introducing Allies, as well as alternative versions of some of the base game mechanisms.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a fixed deck of equipment and power cards, as well as a set of upgrades that can be added directly to a player’s hand during the game. A semi-randomly created board makes for a different landscape every time the game is played, and randomized sets of encounters and enemies create different challenges for players to face before their time runs out.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists introduces more of what made Mistfall great, making it a good entry point for new gamers, as well as a solid expansion for existing fans. With next to no elements replicated from the base set, Heart of the Mists is the perfect addition to the existing Mistfall set – and a challenging experience both solitaire, as well as with a group of up to three friends.

Gather up your resolve, check your gear and get ready to go to the smoldering heart of the unrelenting Mists!

You are part of a colony of intelligent spiders in a secret military research base struggling to survive in a harsh “Bug eat Bug” world. Build your web, grow your colony and enhance your skills as you struggle to gain food and fend off attackers. There is an ominous humming sound as the Hoover-Bot 3000 gets closer and closer to the web, threatening a to destroy to your colony in a horrible Hoovergeddon. Your only chance is build an EMP (Electro Magnetic Pulse weapon) from parts you find in the lab and fire it off to destroy the Hoover-Bot. Can you build the EMP in time, or will you be overrun by attacking critters and meet your Hoovergeddon.

Game Description

Arachnid is a cooperative game for 2-4 players. Each player is a spider with unique abilities controlled by their own action board with upgradable worker placement spots. The center play area is a hex grid, where the spiders reside and tiles are placed as the web is spun. This shared web is the spider’s home, where food is trapped, new skills are acquired, and new workers are hatched.

Flies occasionally fly by, becoming trapped, and eventually, food. Players influence when the Flies are triggered, but this also increases the risk of Critters attacking the web. It's a fine balance between starvation and safety. Players can also enhance their spider skills, but this involves sacrificing parts of their valuable web home.

How to lose

-If the web somehow becomes detached from the edges of the board due to critter attacks, it will mean the end of the colony.

-if the Golden Scarab reached the Den in the center of the web , then "Activates", the colony will be destroyed.

-If the the Hoover-Bot reaches the web, the game will end in a horrible Hoovergeddon.

How to win

Find enough spare parts to create the EMP, then all spiders meet at the Den to set it off and fry the Hoover-Bot. Easy as Pie!

—description from the publisher

TriATri is a must-follow trick-taking game in which the players each aim to score the most points.

The "lead suit" is determined by the color of gem chosen by the lead player, from either in front of themselves or a central pool.  The winner of the trick will take the gem.  Players earn positive points for complete sets of gems (1 of each color), and will typically lose points for incomplete sets.

The cards have a relationship such that their value may be multiplied depending upon the color of the previously played card.

You can play in the board game arena.
https://boardgamearena.com/gamepanel?game=triatri

An competitive action target-shooting game in which two pirate or buccaneer players shoot marbles from their cannons in order to “sink” their opponent’s two ships in the middle of the game board.

When struck just the right way, the plastic pirate ship aligns up with the slot in the board, causing them to drop in and "sink".

The player who sinks both of the opponent's ships first, wins.

RAIN is a solo game about auditory hallucinations.  The games comes as an A3 sheet of paper, with the rules and a diagram to help understand the board printed on the rear. Players are expected to provide any other required components.

The board has different tracks for the volume of the protagonist's hallucinations, the current time, and the time you expect the hallucinations to subside.

The player will use a die to determine if the current volume of rain is enough to drown out the hallucinations.  If it is, the player will be able to advance the current time on the tracks.  If it is not, the player is instructed to wait a period of time equal to the distance between the current time and the time they were trying to move on that track.

The time tracks are in 8 different units, such as seconds, minutes, hours, days, and weeks.

The rules include an exception for the game ending in case the remaining period of the game would exceed your expected lifetime.

Description from the publisher: Roll the die and be the first to complete a butterfly or a moth. Watch out because your opponents can swipe your cards, but so can you. Each card includes fun butterfly facts.

In this card turning, set collecting game, a roll of the die determines the action you can take.

2014 Creative Child Magazine Preferred Choice Award

Capybaras love to eat pumpkins. You’ll need the help of the baby monkey walking above to pick up the pumpkins that the capybaras like to eat. You, the players, play as capybara bosses, aiming to line up your capybaras well to earn lots of pumpkins!

In Capybara, you will form a line of capybaras to score Pumpkin cards. You will move the baby monkey above the row of capybaras to carry out different actions. You gain Capybara cards by moving the baby monkey forward to the left, gaining capybaras for the number of spaces moved.

You can also score Pumpkin cards by forming a row of capybaras that meet the Pumpkin scoring conditions, moving the monkey to the left to score them.

—description from the publisher

Adoption fees have been paid and new cats (and a pig!) are entering your home for more mayhem and fun. Choose between three all new characters to add to your game, team up using new Team cards, or increase your game's challenge with new Stress cards.


     New Playable Characters
     New Team Cards
     New Stress Cards


—description from the publisher

Welcome to Encyclopedia! The year is 1739, and as aspiring naturalists and adventurers, you’ve been hired by the Comte de Buffon - Darwin's predecessor - to help him create the first encyclopedia of natural history. To do so, you’ll be conducting research, organizing ambitious expeditions and publishing studies of the world’s most fascinating creatures!

Encyclopedia is a dice-based worker placement game. At the beginning of each round, you’ll be drawing and rolling dice, then placing them on your player board. These dice can then be used to perform an action each turn, depending on their color and value. Your action can be preparing your expeditions by going to the Embassy, visiting the Bank to raise funds, or hiring your research team at the University. Once you’re ready to go, you’ll choose the Animal cards you wish to study, then organize expeditions to observe them in their natural habitats. When your research is complete, you’ll then be able to publish your findings in an attempt to become the biggest contributor to Buffon’s Encyclopedia. Every publication you make will earn you Victory points, and at the end of the game, you’ll score points based on collections of Animals and research amassed during play. The naturalist with the most points wins!

Encyclopedia was designed by Olivier Melison and Eric Dubus, the authors of Dominations: Road to Civilization and Museum. This expert worker placement game brings some fascinating new twists to the genre, offering multiple paths to victory. The game also offers a multitude of ways to counter the random element of your dice rolls. As well as being able to spend different tokens to change the value or color of a die, players have more than just their own dice to choose from, as other players dice can also be used! Taking a die from another player’s board does not cost anything, but the targeted player gains a bonus.

The game’s beautiful theme - with gorgeously illustrated animal cards - ties in strongly with its mechanics, making the rules easy to grasp so that you can jump straight in to devising the perfect strategy.

—description from the publisher
A Monopoly-like game based on a ironic reinterpretation of Turin.

Hero Hockey is a dexterity game that you play underneath the board.Move a magnet under the table to maneuver your "hero". Defend your goal and shoot toward your opponent's goal in this mashup of air hockey and foosball.

Each player controls one defender. The magnetic connection created between your steering magnet and the hero pawn brings the characters to life and lets you take direct control of your hero. Defend your goal and employ ball control, skill shots, and precision accuracy to get the ball into the opponent’s goal.

The first player to 6 points wins!

Get rid of your cards as quickly as possible to obtain the most points. Over and out!

Walkie Talkie is a co-operative game in which players have a very limited amount of time — 30 seconds per player — to get rid of all the cards in their hand, and the more cards that you play, the higher your score.

Everybody has a hand of six cards; cards have a letter on one side and a color on another, and you have to hold your cards however they're dealt to you. Place one card from the deck letter side up and another color side up. When the timer starts, everybody plays at the same time. You can play a letter on the letter pile as long as you can name something that starts with that letter and that "matches" the current color showing; similarly, you can play a color on the color pile as long as you can name something of that color that starts with the letter atop the letter pile. For example, when playing a "B" card next to a yellow card, you could say "Banana!", and when playing an orange card next to an "L", you could say "Lion!" You can't repeat a word previously given, and you can't name the color of the color card.

Whenever you want, you can say "Roger!", and all players must flip the cards in their hand, so letters become colors and vice versa. Alternatively, you can say "Over!", and players pass their cards to the left.

When time runs out, you gain points equal to the number of stars on played letter cards, then subtract 1 point for each unplayed card. Try to score as many points as you can!

Yammer is a game where you make words from letter cards in your hand and on the table to score the most points possible. The deck has 108 cards: 51 red letters, 51 orange letters, 2 wild cards, 2 2x multiplier cards, and 2 3x multiplier cards. It has rules for four games:

Yammer:  Make a new word from cards in the hand and/or the well, scoring the sum of the letter values, doubled if they are all the same color, and times any multiplier cards played. Cards from the deck are used to replenish the well first, and then the hand. The highest score when the deck runs out wins.

Yammer Solitaire: Yammer for one player, aiming to have a high score at the end, or the fewest cards unused.

Yammy: Gin Rummy with the Yammer deck.  Wild cards and multipliers are removed. Players start with 9-card hands, and on their turn they draw from the top of the draw or discard pile, and then discard a card. The round ends when one player can use their whole hand to spell words, each of which must be of the same color.  Play until winning a target number of rounds or reaching a target total score.

500 Yammy: 500 Rummy with the Yammer deck. Like Yammy, except that players may play single-color words during their turn, and/or add to existing words on the table.  They may also draw any card in the discard pile, but they must use that card to make a word immediately, and must draw all cards above that card in the pile.  A round ends when one person depletes their hand.  Play until reaching a target total score.

Use cards and dice to get four matching popcorn toppings to POP the POPCORN! With matches being rolled on just about every turn, you never know who will be popping next in this high-flying, catch-the-kernel food frenzy!

CONTENTS

1 Popcorn Launcher
3 Popcorn Projectile “kernels”
54 Cards (9 of each popcorn topping “suit”)
3 Dice
30 Popcorn Pog Chips
For 2 or more players. Ages 8 and up.

Not Another Fetch Quest!!! is a fast and fun party card game with a fantasy theme that pokes fun at one of the most annoyingly unnecessary elements in the RPG realm: fetch questing. Take the role of one of the Kingdom of Renfaire's most mundane of heroes and use your wits to conquer the quests before your rivals do.

Each player is represented by a character, which have unique stats and special abilities. Players take turns adding quest cards (with difficulty values that correspond to player stats) to the notice board until a player is challenged. When a player is challenged, they see if their stats (and loot, if needed) can overcome the challenges of the quests.

A player can win in one of two ways: if they win three challenges and get three success tokens, or if the player is the last one standing when all other players fail three challenges. It's suggested to play to two wins/losses if in a group of five or more. Also check out the other play modes for faster or more devious play styles.

The game is played by two parties with 3 planes each. The planes start at two opposite airfields, fly a circuit and return to their base. Movement is determined by a die. The course has several branches, where the players may choose with course to follow. If a plane gets on a space occupied by an enemy plane, the later is shot down and eliminated from the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The party who gets the most planes back to their airfield wins the game.

The Game was published before 1919, when the company still was named "Gebrüder Bing AG".

—user summary

The Battle of TaiYuan puts you on a WWII battlefield in China. You will command your army to fight the enemy.

This is an introductory-level wargame. The game rules are simple and easy to learn. It is very suitable for beginners.

The biggest feature of this game is the combat mechanism. Players can concentrate their units to increase their attack power. They can also disperse their units and cause more losses to the enemy.

—description from the designer

The year is 19XX. As the country's most successful secret agent, [NAME REDACTED], you've been on the hunt for an enemy spy, codename PROTEUS, on board the docked nuclear submarine Retiarius. However, your mission spirals out of control when the Retiarius submerges and its warheads prime for launch!

Danger in the Deep is a collaborative escape room game, where players must navigate their way through the engine room, crew’s quarters, mess and control room of a submarine. Only by gathering key information and solving the 14 interactive puzzles will teams be able to disable the warheads, stop PROTEUS, and save the world. The game features puzzle books, cards, secret components, a blueprint, and a working UV torch (batteries included, 3 x AAA).

Danger in the Deep features a tiered hint system, to enable teams of all abilities to progress through the game and story. The game can optionally be completed solo.

Danger in the Deep is designed as a one-time experience, as some of the puzzles require players to cut, fold and write on the components. However, Professor Puzzle do provide a printable pdf of the destructible components, in the Files section on BGG and on their website, to enable the game to be replayed.

The quirky quiz sees you whiz through just five questions per card – and they’re not that hard!

So what’s the catch? Simple: you always have to give the answer from the question before… With hilarious results!

In Amalfi: Renaissance, players take on the role of merchants in the Italian port town of Amalfi during the Renaissance period. The town was a dominant maritime power during the previous century, but its importance has diminished. The merchants of Amalfi are eager to recapture their previous success and revive the abandoned port town, but they have only four ships.

In this game, players' ships are used to navigate, but also to store their resources. With their resources, they will be able to:


     Discover charts and thus get better destinations for their actions.
     Acquire paints, books, and historical monuments to earn honor and bonuses.
     Invite renowned historical figures to support their strategy.
     Construct new ships to have more workers and take more actions.


The game ends after four rounds, and the player with the most points wins.

This new edition of Amalfi includes new mechanisms (you can now build lighthouses on the map); new characters including new illustrations with si new asymmetrical decks; and rebalanced artworks, charts, decrees, and titles to offer more choices and more replayability, all in a new box with a double-layered main board and individual player boards.

The Shelter is a separate, stand-alone scenario for Mortum. Medieval Detective.

It is a game of deduction and adventures, which takes place in a grim world shaped in the image of medieval Europe, with its legends, superstitions and fears coming to life. Take on the roles of secret organization agents and investigate mysterious and thrilling events. In this stand-alone scenario you will end up in a sinister place marked by mysterious events. While unraveling its secrets, you will meet people of uneasy fate, none of which are faceless "observers". And some of your actions will determine their destiny. Only you and the choices you make decide how the events will unfold in the end. Tread carefully, and welcome to the Shelter!

During each turn, a player chooses one of the cards available this turn. These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, etc. Using the cards and Special Action, which were received during investigation, a player discovers what actually happened.

We recommend to proceed to this scenario after you finished the core storyline of Mortum: Medieval Detective.

However, you may also play this as a stand-alone scenario, without even having the core game and knowing its plot.

Dictator of Sweden is played with two teams, representing democrats and anti-democrats, in the Swedish parliament.

Each player is secretly assigned a role in one of the teams, including 1 role as dictator. The ones assigned as anti-democrats will know each other.

Players in turn, will become prime minister, that suggests another player to form government with. If approved by a majority, that government, may take an authoritarian or democratic decision.

The game ends when 6 authoritarian or 6 democratic decisions have been taken.

Suroborous is an auction game in which the items you bid on will be worth points only if you bid the amounts shown on these items in future auctions — that is, a card may be worth 10 points, but it will show two circles on it, say 30 and 50. The card will not be worth 10 points unless you bid 30 and 50 in future auctions.

The economy is relatively closed with winning bids going to the auctioneer, and the auctioneer's bids going to the bank; however, if any player bids an amount shown on the card up for auction, that card receives a coin from the bank, covering that number.

When the game ends, players earn points for their completed cards, purple cards with special scoring criteria, star symbols on cards, and a bit for leftover money. Of note, players without at least one star symbol are eliminated. Otherwise, the player with the most points wins.

Aliens have descended into the earth’s atmosphere and seek to conquer its inhabitants. Armies around the world are sending out their personnel, weapons and ammunition in order to combat this invasion. Your military division is ready to receive instructions. You have to rely on a network of civilian and military communication to locate the UFOs. Time is of the essence and you must speed to the last spotted location, hopefully with enough ammunition to either shoot them down out of the sky or hunt the down aliens that are on the loose! THE FATE OF THE EARTH IS IN YOUR HANDS!

Inspired by Jon Meitling's Palm Island, Invasion is the hand held solo game where you try to shoot down the UFOs and then hunt down any surviving aliens. Rotate and store cards to increase your military’s ammunition, speed and efficiency. When you have enough, you can shoot down an UFO or hunt down a an alien. The further you progress, the more likely that UFOs or aliens will appear.

With “ON THE FLY” embedded variant technology, you can increase the challenge of the game or simply add variety to the game without having to add any cards. The variants are found in the top right corner. As head of a military division, your goal is to shoot down as many UFOs and hunt down as many aliens as possible At the end of the game, you will tally your score by the icons in the top left corner.

A game with a fast paced mechanic based on puzzling in which players try to put in his/her turn as many pieces of his/her painting in an area delimited by a frame.

Each player has a different puzzle but one condition is always true: they both has the same cutting pattern. As there is not enough space for all the pieces of inside the frame, on his turn a player try to put as many pieces as he/she can in order to contribute the most to the whole puzzle, which will result a hybrid of both images.

The game ends when the frame is completed. The winner is the player who has put more pieces inside the frame.
Create new stories featuring the characters from the animated film "My Neighbor Totoro" using a new set of 9 dice. Roll the dice and let your imagination wander.

This is an epic fantasy competitive game of strategy, adventure, resource management and Kingdom building, with a large world map, massive card decks, miniatures, modified dice rolling and lore driven.

All our tales are forgotten in the Sunset of All life, is what the people of Zamrock believe. Our Tale about Invasion takes us right to the Eye of Zamrock, or how people there call it - ‘the Eye’.

It is now nearing the end of the Eight Age after the Becoming and by surprise, the Demon King was slain while trying to set hold in the Eye. This left his younger brother Lorial unattained and a new King of Demon Realm. The New King's lust for vengeance and hatred against all life pushed him to force open a portal in the middle of the Eye at the Crystal Lake Iris.

It was in this dark hour that the almost forgotten prophecy was unearthed. It speaks of one Kingdom that will rise above all others and build a Crystal Tower that will shine the light which will destroy the invaders and cast its beam to discover the Truth that will save the Eye and free all.

But the the prophecy brought hope as much as the divide, for Kings’ ambitions extend beyond the current conflict, as each one hopes to emerge from the war as the strongest ruler, worthy of uniting Zamrock under a single banner.

There are many paths to victory, but not all lead to saving the world. Become the leader of one of Six Kingdoms of the Eye and balance your relationship with other players and your ulterior motives to become the leading Kingdom in order to attain the most victory points. Command your Kingdom where you build up your city, armies, equip your Hero through quests, and expand with your Emissary and fight Demon forces who have built a Portal in the iris of the world to destroy everything. There are five different areas in which your Kingdom can gain influence - Battle, Trade, Build, Quest and Colonization. Enough influence points allow you to acquire crystals needed to construct Crystal Tower.

Demons win if any of the Kingdoms fail to build their Crystal Tower to level three by the end of the 24th Turn of play. If the Tower is built, demon Portal closes and a celebratory Tournament is held. Kingdom with the most EOZ Medals, in the end, wins the game.

Be advised, straying too much from the path of stopping the invasion can make everything you do to expand your Kingdom futile.

—description from the designer
